alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southwestern Lincoln Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 8 miles east of Matheson to 17 miles southwest of Forder, or along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Limon to 37 miles northwest of North La Junta. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kutch, Karval, Wild Horse Point, Forder and Punkin Center. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
